runs.comm: holds it's line just outside off. This was on a good length and drew Guptill forward. But I suspect he was playing inside the line in an attempt to leave there
this ducks back in off a fuller length and Guptill has nudged it towards midwicket
fullish and kept just wide of off stump, left alone
finds the outside edge but it goes wide of the lone slip in place. Williamson was pressing forward and driving away from the body. Single to deep third man
flicked past a diving short fine leg as this was full and sliding down leg
probes outside off stump with a short of a good length delivery, Guptill is wise to the tactics and the equation and leaves

comes down the track, while ensuring he has room to try and flay through through the covers. It was the offcutter from Mathews and it fetches the inside edge which misses off stump on the way to the keeper
short ball just outside off and Williamson pulls to deep square leg
good length ball just outside off, Guptill blocks off the back foot
taps to mid-on and Guptill races down the pitch. Malinga was the fielder and he isn't reputed to be too quick off the grass
shortish ball just outside off, he nudges it into the vacant midwicket region and he's placed it perfectly for a couple
that's where he should not have bowled. Drifts a length ball down the leg side and Williamson has paddled it well past the lone man in the region - short fine leg
back of a length and outside off, punched to cover point
curls back in appreciably, but Guptil negotiates it well with a push wide of mid-on
Dar stretches his arms wide as this shortish delivery is angled down the leg side. Williamson looks to glance it and doesn't connect
swerves back in off this fulller length ball on off stump, Williamson was looking to clip through midwicket and gets an inside edge onto pad. Makes Sri lanka's appeal useless

ugly hack from Williamson and it becomes an ugly boundary as the inside edge runs away to fine leg. Fuller ball on middle and leg, he backs away for a slog, lucky as that was quite close to the stumps
another indipper from Kula and this one is met with a full face of the bat. Still the movement is enough to hit the inside edge again
bit of extra bounce as this back of a length ball thuds into the shoulder of Williamson's bat as he looks to block. Good soft hands there

flighted on off stump and Guptill lunges forward to push to mid-on. Sets off for a single straight away but his partner is not at all interested. The bowler is wise to the mistake, rushes across to his right and cuts the ball in it's path and sends in a rocket throw and Sanga whips the bails off with a little more oomph than necessary
lovely flight from Herath as Baz comes forward and blocks
tosses it up and angles it on leg stump, Baz looks to nudge it off his toes but doesn't hit it
plunges his front foot outside off to defend this flighted delivery into the covers
goes on with the arm and they go up in a loud appeal. Baz was coming forward to defend, but he was playing down the wrong line and wears it on the pads. Would have slid down leg

Herath, you beauty! Lures Baz out of his crease and his keeper does the rest! His flight was making the batsman nervous and he decided hitting out was the only option. Poor choice and Sri Lanka are right back in this. What lovely manipulation of flight from Herath!
back of a length and just outside off, defended into hte covers
full and a little too wide outside off, easily left alone
full and cuts back in at him, Williamson essays the perfect forward defensive
rampant inswing from Kula and Williamson is a little slow on the forward defensive. Gets an inside edge onto the top flap of the pad
solid drive to mid-off as this was full and swinging into off stump. He needs to drop anchor and he seems to know it
fullish and outside off, Williamson comes forward to block
short ball, picked up and deposited to the midwicket boundary. Saw it early, went deep in his crease and pummeled it over the top.
tossed up on middle and he gets forward and defends
this one spun and Taylor did well to just get his bat behind to defend
there's a forward short leg  and the ball lobs to him and there's an appeal, that went off the pad
close shout for an lbw! This one spun and hit the back leg in front of the stumps, he was playing against the turn, Taylor very lucky to survive

and a ball later Herath strikes and the umpire is convinced! This was bowled flatter and quicker, Taylor was forward to defend, didn't cover the line and the ball didn't exactly turn and went through with the angle, struck on the pads in front of middle
timber! Neesham beaten for turn there, Herath tosses this up from round the wicket, Neesham was forward and across and left a gap between pad and bat, the ball spins and hits the leg stump
length ball on the pads and tucked away behind square
good length outside off and cramped him up and he defends to the off side
drifts on the body and he clips him away to fine leg
slower ball yorker on the pads and he just about manages to clip it away
this was nicely punched away square of the wicket but backward point did well to get a hand to it
slower ball and he gets forward and angles it to the off side
gorgeous flight and drift, but Williamson has come forward and calmly blocked it
goes wide of the crease and pushes a flatter delivery on middle and leg, Williamson picks it away through midwicket. That's the first run he's conceded in 14 balls

another one bites the dust! Herath is spinning circles around New Zealand and the Sri Lanka fans have found their voice! Another ripping turner, pitching on middle and turning away to strike the back pad rather low. Ronchi was in no way convicing with a feeble flick. Would have slammed into off stump
walks across outside off to nudge this flighted delivery into midwicket
tossed up outside off even as N Mac moves across to stand on off stump. Defended to point
tossed up on off stump, he shuffles across again in hopes of preventing the leg before and pushes down to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
guides the shortish ball outside off to point
fullish on off stump, N Mac comes forward and blocks to mid-on
ducks back in off a shortish length and he works it wide of mid-on
steered behind point as this was shortish with a bit of room on offer. Everything riding on Williamson now
follows the New Zealand plan earlier as he keeps to a shortish length outside off and the batsman can't do much more than block
grips into the pitch and foils his timing. Lobs uppishly towards the vacant midwicket region
neatly nudged through midwicket for a single

presents a simple catch to midwicket! Another one that holds on the pitch a little more, and the elder McCullum also succumbs to a brain fade. Moves across to off stump and clips it straight to the fielder
goes deep in his crease despite this being rather full, and blocks
flighted on off stump and turns into him. Mills blocks on the front foot
covers all his stumps and blocks the tossed up delivery on middle
back of a length and on that off stump corridor, Williamson plants an angled bat and finds point
full on off stump, he comes forward to block again
chips it over mid-on! Charges him and though it was short to throw him off, Williamson flat-bats it away and gets enough power on it
slower ball, lobbed up full on middle. Willliamson pushes to long-on
shortish and outside off, cuts to point
tapped to point again, some good timing from Mills
keeps to a good length just outside off and it's punched back to the bowler
this is the doosra and I think Williamson picked it and punched to cover.
loads more flight on this one as it drifts in, Williamson pushes forward and blocks
orthodox offie this time and it turns and bounces to take the inside edge of Williamson's bat. No close-in fielders though
this was flatter on middle and he goes back and clips to midwicket
a little too much flight there and Mills uses his reach to press forward and block
skips down the track and was making a bit of room as well, had to reach for it which hurts his timing. Whacked down the ground ofr a single
poor ball from Mathews, can't bowl short at his pace and Williamson punishes him with a solid pull shot. Beats square leg comfortably
back of a length just outside off, punched to mid-off
backs away as this was fired a lot fuller on middle. Got his bat between the ball and his stumps and the bottom edge saves him.
this has room on offer and he's belted that through the covers. Top shot as he had to take the slower ball on the up
dug in quite short and he goes for a pull. Too high for him to connect
wanted to chop this away behind point, but it skids on from the pitch a little too quickly
waits on it and pushes down the ground, past the non-striker

goes for the reverse sweep. Nothing more than an escape shot, struck on the knee-roll and this seemed to be sneaking down leg, but the umpire doesn't think so. Concerted appeal from Sri Lanka and they've gotten away with one. This was sliding down leg, HawkEye says
flighted on off stump and he keeps it out
this turns away again and Boult can't really pick it. Wafts a little bat outside off and misses
slower yorker on off stump, kept out quite nicely
another slower ball, Williamson chips it down to long-on and takes the single
goes for the short one on leg stump, Boult is not comfortable behind it but he's managed a leg bye behind square on the leg side
yorker goes wrong, when was the last time you saw that from Malinga. This is way down leg and Williamson glances it away to the fine-leg boundary
139kph, fires a yorker in on middle this time and Williamson is almost pushed off his feet. Still manages to nudge to deep square leg
there's the slow, dipping yorker from Malinga and Boult does very well to prevent it from clattering into his stumps
skips down the track and gets a leading edge which clears the cover infield. Absolute confusion out there and Williamson has been run-out at the bowlers'.
flighted just outside off, pushed down towards mid-on but Herath races after it himself

that's five for Herath! Sri Lanka go through to the semi-final! Saw the batsman racing down the track and shortened his length. Gets some turn off the deck as well, which he tries to ride. But there is a slip in place and Mahela pouches it safely.
